reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup:** Narda Clone, Single coil  26g Kanthal @.7 ohms.  25W Power, Half wicked with Native Wicks Platinum Blend

**Testing:** FW Dr. Pepper Type @ 4%. 70/30 VG/PG, steeped 8 days.

**Flavor Description:**  This tastes like a warm, flat generic Dr. Pepper. I don't mean for that to sound bad because it is quite delicious with a tad bit of effervescence. I am not getting just a straight cherry cola like I was so afraid I would. It tastes pretty authentic to the Dr. Pepper, or even better, Mr. Pibb, profile. 

**Off-flavors:**  I don't get anything that is not supposed to be there

**Throat Hit:**  It is pretty smooth, nothing like I was expecting.


**Uses & Pairings:**  I would honestly vape this standalone or maybe with some vbic or vanila shisha for a float type mix.

**Notes:**
I really like this flavor. It has not changed much in the 8 days I let it steep so you could vape it right away with maybe the only difference is a little bit of a throat hit but nothing too harsh. 

**Second Opinions:**

[Not much in the way of ELR Notes](http://e-liquid-recipes.com/flavor/35802)
Someone did comment saying that it tasted more like rootbeer to them.


**[DIY_eJuice Flavor Reviews](https://www.reddit.com/r/DIY_eJuice/wiki/index/flavor_reviews)**

If you have different opinions on the flavor or any ideas on how to use it please post them in the comments. Lets start a discussion!
reviewsJson.author: mlNikon
reviewsJson.title: Dr. Pepper Type
